document.docAuthor: Kaya, Sarp, Chobanov, Dragan, Heller, Klaus-Gerhard, Yahyaoğlu, Özgül, Uluar, Onur & Çiplak, Battal
document.docTitle: Poecilimon martinae subsp. martinae martinae Heller 2004
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Poecilimon species with inflated pronotum: description of four new taxa within an acoustically diverse group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Poecilimon species with inflated pronotum: description of four new taxa within an acoustically diverse group

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type data.
Holotype , male
; Turkey , Antalya , near Çıralı-Olympos (ca. 60 km ssw Antalya ), 36.410° N , 30.465° E ( CH 5450, Collection Heller).

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. See Heller (2004) in addition to data here.

Material examined. TURKEY : 1 M, 1 F (CH5487-8), Antalya , 35 km (ss)w Antalya , 36.607o N , 30.545o E ,
29.v.1999
, leg. R. Zhantiev ( CH )
;
3 MM, 3 FF ( CH 5449-54), Antalya , near Çıralı-Olimpos (ca. 60 km ssw Antalya )
,
10 m
, 36.400o N , 30.467o E ,
28.v.2000
, leg. K.- G. Heller ( CH ) (sound record); 1 M, 1 F ( CH 5407-8),
Antalya
, 10 km east of Kumluca (ca. 70 km ssw
Antalya
)
,
300 m
, 36.365o N , 30.371o E ,
04.vi.2000
, leg. K.- G. Heller ( CH ) (sound record); 3 MM, 3 FF, Antalya , Kozdere , Köprü , west of Kemer 36.563o N , 30.546o E ,
25.v.2009
, leg. V. Vedenina & K.- G. Heller (sound record); 1 M, Antalya , Kale , Üçagiz near Demre , 36.19894o N , 29.84480o E ,
4.vi.2014
(CC).

Remarks. Heller (2004) reported that the records of
P. inflatus
by Yalım & Çıplak (2002) from Antalya , Termessos and that by Sevgili (2001) from Kemer refer to
P. martinae martinae
. The two male used by Yalım & Çıplak (2002) were re-examined and clearly identified as
P. isopterus
sp. n.
described in this study. On the other hand, data obtained during this study indicate that
P. isopterus
sp. n.
occurs in relatively high altitudes (> 500 m as in Termessos and İbradı) while other close relatives such as
P. martinae
and
P. inflatus
were recorded along a narrow band along the coast. Thus, we propose that
P. martinae martinae
occurs along a narrow band starting from Kemer and extending to Demre. In this case the following localities of
P. martinae martinae
given in Heller (2004) possibly is based on mislabelling: TURKEY : 2 FF ( CH 1551-52 ), Antalya , Termessos, 36" 58' N, 30'' 30' E, 0 8.06.1985, leg. H. Wolf ( CH ).
